item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

String[] letters = new String[]{"a","b"...etc}; System.out.println(letters[(new Random()).nextInt(letters.length)]);

Im pretty sure you can use new char(new Random()).nextInt(26) + baseNum, but I would rather be dead sure.

item.title: Need some help with random picking of numbers
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

i was just about to say should it be like that but java.utill*

[code]import Java.util.Random;
public class pass
{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
Random rand = new Random();

	int var1 = rand.nextInt(9) + 1;
	int var2 = rand.nextInt(9) + 1;
	int var3 = rand.nextInt(9) + 1;
	int var4 = rand.nextInt(9) + 1;
	int var5 = rand.nextInt(9) + 1;

	System.out.println("" + var1 + " " + var2 + " " + var3 + " " + var4 + " " + var5 + " ");
}

}[/code]

like that because i still get a load of errors

item.title: Need some help with random picking of numbers
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

hay all i need some help with random picking of numbers i want to get my program to pick a number from 1-9 and save it to a int witch i them can display

e.g

[code]public class pass
{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
int var1 = 0;
int var2 = 0;
int var3 = 0;
int var4 = 0;
int var5 = 0;

	var1 = 0;
	var2 = 0;
	var3 = 0;
	var4 = 0;
	var5 = 0;

	System.out.println("" + var1 + " " + var1 + " " + var1 + " " + var1 + " " + var1 + " ");
}

}
[/code]

this part is were the program would have to pick a number from 0-9

var1 = 0; var2 = 0; var3 = 0; var4 = 0; var5 = 0;

any help is appreciated

p.s could you please post a code sample
